subject: setup-gummiboot-conf: Disable VGA output in splash-hdmi .conf
commitMessage:
setup-gummiboot-conf: Disable VGA output in splash-hdmi .conf

This is a supplementary patch on top of
40e26bbb19f0450a0495263798ebe6cee4e736ae

*splash-hdmi.conf is primarily used by Minnowboard MAX. The board
only contains a mini-HDMI port and VGA/DP ports are not available.

Therefore, also VGA needs to be disabled to avoid GMBUS timeout.

v2: Update commit log

Bug-Tizen: TC-2195/part
Signed-off-by: Fang, Neo <neo.fang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Mikko Ylinen <mikko.ylinen@intel.com>

subject: setup-gummiboot-conf: Add HDMI/DP specific splash .conf entries
commitMessage:
setup-gummiboot-conf: Add HDMI/DP specific splash .conf entries

Unused digital display outputs cause a kernel boot timeout that adds
to system boot up time:

"[drm] GMBUS [i915 gmbus dpb] timed out, falling back to bit banging on pin 5"

The problem goes away by disabling unused outputs: video:<output>:d.

However, the problem gets complicated since VTC1010 provides only DP-1 connector,
and MinnowBoard MAX provides only HDMI-A-1 connector. The solution is to generate
HDMI and DP specific splash .conf entries. The desired config entry can be enabled
based on the platform.

Change-Id: I8544ee7cf15d7b4fb8837147e5149cca2f8c6b7e
Bug-Tizen: TC-2195
Signed-off-by: Mikko Ylinen <mikko.ylinen@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

well as talked online

I am not fan of kernel flags into this helper program...

alternative would be to have cmdline file
and generate one entry per file ie : /boot/cmdline-$config-$KVER

This will makes setup-script profile/platform agnostic

but I am ok to merge it

since we already had kernel params ... 

let me invite to file bug to remove them all and provide a such mechanism if it's doable the way I described
Uploaded patch set 2.

I'd propose to accept this.

I'm OK to revisit how cmdline is populated but hope to do it after the release is out.

Signed-off-by: Philippe Coval <philippe.coval@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

looks good but I would prefer to save and restore the previous context

as you can figure you it helps to detect problems
Uploaded patch set 2.
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

You need to check for privilege if you're going to change the Smack label of the process. What do you want to do if you don't have the privilege to change the Smack label? You can abandon the operation, continue with a warning or continue silently. I don't recommend option 3.

Patch Set 2:

this script is executed as root, it installs a hard drive with the fresh system.
Hard to do without high privileges.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

OK then.

Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
